duties_responsibilities.duty: Design new molecules, in silico docking, QSAR, and physicochemical characterization of cannabinoid-based molecules.
Hone in on functional groups, pharmacophores, and/or motifs to generate better designs.
Design, screen, refine, and justify designs for potential synthesis and subsequent in vitro and in vivo characterization of lead compounds.
Prepare manuscripts and grants related to chemical product characterization.
Ensure project timelines and milestones are met and work seamlessly with extended team at CRO’s, CMO’s, and development partners.
Present the rationale, key data, issues, and accomplishments of the in silico and early drug development program to internal stakeholders, external collaborators, and in scientific forums.

education_certification.credential: Ph.D. degree in chemistry or related field with 2-3 years experience, or MS degree with 5-7 years experience.
R&D experience with cannabinoid chemistry and pharmacology is preferred.
Previous experience preparing manuscripts and grants is preferred.
Contemporary expertise in early drug development and cannabinoid motifs preferred.
